normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs! Film festival season is heating up, and things are about to get filmi! From Cannes to our very own International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa, cinephiles are gearing up for a cinematic feast. Word on the street is that this year’s lineup is packed with some seriously impressive Indian indie flicks. We're talking groundbreaking narratives and performances that'll leave you craving more than just a plate of hot biryani. Remember last year's "Gully Boy" fever at Berlin? This year, several films are already creating a buzz, with whispers of awards and potential international distribution deals. Keep an eye out for new talents emerging from smaller towns – think aspiring filmmakers from places like Patna or even smaller villages. They're bringing fresh perspectives and stories to the big screen. And speaking of screens, don’t forget the regional festivals happening across the country. From the Kerala Film Festival coinciding around Onam to smaller events in Kolkata, there's a cinematic celebration happening almost every week. So grab your popcorn, settle in, and get ready to experience the magic of cinema!
